title: Why didn't Hitler focus on seizing Egypt to secure the oil in the Middle East? - Quora

response.answer_text: They did, the Afrika Korps - Wikipedia which consists of several panzer divisions in 1941 commanded by one of their better general Erwin Rommel. Unfortunately Hitler also decided to initate Operation Barbarossa - Wikipedia that year a few months later, the invasion of Russia. The Eastern front became a slog and consumed most of the resources of Nazi Germany, and they found it difficult to reinforce their African campaign. They had to eventually withdraw from Africa after sustained British opposition. Their Italian allies were not much help

You are not looking at the situation as it existed in World War Two. There was almost NO oil in the middle east during the war, the oil there was not developed until the 1950s. The oil at the time was in Russia, the USA, Indonesia, Venezuala, and Romania So how would siezing Egypt help Germany? There was almost no oil in the middle east for another 10 years AFTER the war. The British were not using the Suez Canal all that much, supplies for India and South East Asia were going around Africa anyway because the Mediterranean was not safe at all for convoys.
